Class RunBank

java.lang.Object
RunBank
public class RunBank extends Object
The RunBank class provides a main program for simulating a banking system. It reads customer data from a CSV file, allows customers and bank managers to interact with their accounts, and logs transactions.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main method reads customer data from a CSV file and starts the banking system, allowing the user to log in as either a customer, a bank manager, or a bank teller.
      Parameters:
      args - command-line arguments (not used)

    • inquireBalance

      public static void inquireBalance(Customer customer)
      Displays the details of the customer's checking, savings, and credit accounts.
      Parameters:
      customer - the customer whose balances are being inquired

    • depositMoney

      public static void depositMoney(Customer customer, Scanner scanner)
      Allows the customer to deposit money into their checking, savings, or credit account.
      Parameters:
      customer - the customer who is making the deposit
      scanner - the scanner to read user inputs

    • withdrawMoney

      public static void withdrawMoney(Customer customer, Scanner scanner)
      Allows the customer to withdraw money from their checking or savings account.
      Parameters:
      customer - the customer who is making the withdrawal
      scanner - the scanner to read user inputs

    • transferMoney

      public static void transferMoney(Customer customer, Scanner scanner)
      Allows the customer to transfer money between their checking and savings accounts.
      Parameters:
      customer - the customer making the transfer
      scanner - the scanner to read user inputs

    • paySomeone

      public static void paySomeone(HashMap<String,Customer> customers, String payerName, String firstNameRecipient, String lastNameRecipient, Scanner scanner)
      Allows the customer to pay another customer by transferring money from their checking account to the recipient's checking account.
      Parameters:
      customers - HashMap of all customers
      payerName - index of the paying customer
      firstNameRecipient - first name of the recipient
      lastNameRecipient - last name of the recipient
      scanner - the scanner to read user inputs

    • getAmount

      public static double getAmount(String transactionType, Scanner scanner)
      Prompts the user to enter an amount for a specific transaction type, validates the input,
      Parameters:
      transactionType - string indicating the type of transaction
      scanner - the scanner to read user inputs
      Returns:
      A valid transaction amount as a double

    • addNewCustomer

      public static void addNewCustomer(HashMap<String,Customer> customersByName, Scanner scanner)
      Adds a new customer to the system by prompting for personal and account information. This method gathers the customer's first name, last name, date of birth, address, and phone number. It then creates a password, checking, savings, and credit accounts with unique account numbers and an assigned credit limit based on a random credit score. If a customer with the same name already exists, it prompts for a unique name.
      Parameters:
      customersByName - A map of customer names to Customer objects, used to store and check for unique names
      scanner - A Scanner object for reading user input
